oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Novel zeotype frameworks with soft cyclodiphosphazane linkers and soft Cu4X4 clusters as nodes
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SIDDIQUI, MM
MOBIN, SM
SENKOVSKA, I
KASKEL, S
BALAKRISHNA, MS
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: METAL-ORGANIC FRAMEWORK
ZEOLITIC IMIDAZOLATE FRAMEWORKS
POROUS COORDINATION POLYMERS
REVERSIBLE CONVERSION
COMPLEXES
REDOX
MACROCYCLE
CHEMISTRY
LIGANDS
FAMILY
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two novel cyclodiphosphazane cluster frameworks with Cu4X4 clusters as tetrahedral nodes and ferrocenyl cyclodiphosphazanes [Fe(n(5)-C5H4)(2)((PNBu)-Bu-t)(2)] as ditopic linkers have been synthesized. These frameworks having sodalite topology display a unique integration of porosity and redox activity and offer new opportunities for the synthesis of zeotype frameworks with soft phosphorus-based ligands.
